Sequence.Title: 2018–2019 V1 Standard Verification Independent Student Sequence
Sequence.EndStateForm: Custom - Confirmation Standard No Auto Close

Forms.Name: 2018 2019 V1 Independent Verification Step 1
Forms.Title: 2018-2019 V1 Standard Verification Independent Student
Forms.Html:
Your 2018–2019 Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) was selected for review in a process called Verification. The law states that before awarding Federal Student Aid, we must ask you to confirm the information you reported on your FAFSA. To verify that you provided correct information, the Student Financial Services Office will compare your FAFSA with the information on this worksheet and with any other required documents. If there are differences, your FAFSA information may need to be corrected.

1. Student Information

  • Yourself

  • Your spouse, if you are married.

  • Other people if they now live with you and you provide more than half of their support and will continue to provide more than half of their support through June 30, 2019.

  • Your children, if any, if you will provide more than half of their support from July 1, 2018 through June 30, 2019. If you reported child support paid on your FAFSA do not include child in your household size as the amount paid has already been calculated by FAFSA.

  • Include the name of the college for any household member, who will be enrolled, at least half time in a degree, diploma, or certificate program at a postsecondary educational institution any time between July 1, 2018 and June 30, 2019. If more space is needed, attach a separate page with the student’s name and Social Security Number at the top.

Forms.Html:
2. Household Information
Please complete the table below, include:
  • Yourself

  • Your spouse, if you are married.

  • Other people if they now live with you and you provide more than half of their support and will continue to provide more than half of their support through June 30, 2019.

  • Your children, if any, if you will provide more than half of their support from July 1, 2018 through June 30, 2019. If you reported child support paid on your FAFSA do not include child in your household size as the amount paid has already been calculated by FAFSA.

  • Include the name of the college for any household member, who will be enrolled, at least half time in a degree, diploma, or certificate program at a postsecondary educational institution any time between July 1, 2018 and June 30, 2019. If more space is needed, attach a separate page with the student’s name and Social Security Number at the top.

3. 2016 Income Information
Instructions for 2016 Tax Filers: Complete this section if the student or spouse filed a 2016 IRS income tax return(s). The best way to verify income is by using the IRS Data Retrieval Tool (IRS DRT) that is part of FAFSA on the Web at FAFSA.gov. In most cases, no further documentation is needed to verify 2016income information that was transferred into the student’s FAFSA using the IRS DRT if that information was not changed by the FAFSA filer.
Check the box that applies:
Instructions for 2016 Non-tax Filers: Complete this section if the student or spouse (if married) will not file and are not required to file a 2016 income tax return with the IRS. Non-tax Filers are required to provide a Statement of Non- filing Letter from the IRS. See Step 4 for the requirements of a Statement of Non-filing for 2016.
Check the box that applies:

Forms.Title: 2018-2019 V1 Standard Verification Independent Student

Forms.Html:
5. Other Information to Be Verified
Complete this section if someone in the student’s household (listed in Section 2) received benefits from the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program or SNAP (formerly known as food stamps) any time during the 2015 or 2016 calendar years.
Complete this section if you or your spouse, if married, paid child support in 2016.
6. Certification and Signature
The student must sign and date this worksheet. By signing, you certify that all of the information reported on this worksheet is complete and correct.
WARNING: If you purposely give false or misleading information on this worksheet, you may be fined, be sentenced to jail, or both..

Forms.Name: 2018 2019 V1 Independent Verification Step 4
Forms.Title: 2018-2019 V1 Standard Verification Independent Student
Forms.Html: Please upload all supporting documentation and select "Submit". If you do not have any documentation to upload, select "Submit" to complete the Verification process.
